alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Carver; Dakota; Freeborn; Hennepin; Ramsey; Rice; Scott; Steele; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 9:01PM CST until December 28 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...ANOTHER WINTER SYSTEM FOR TUESDAY... .Snow will develop across Minnesota mid to late morning and push into Wisconsin during the afternoon. Totals are expected to range from 2 to 5 inches, with the highest amounts likely found across central Minnesota. The snow could turn to freezing drizzle for a time before ending Tuesday evening across east central and southeast Minnesota into western Wisconsin. Minor ice accumulations are also possible. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect north of I-94 in western Wisconsin and central Minnesota, and east of I-35 in southern Minnesota. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of west central Wisconsin and east central and south central Minnesota. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 9 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Anoka; Carver; Dakota; Freeborn; Hennepin; Ramsey; Rice; Scott; Steele; Washington
